3. Check for inconsistencies in the data: There are no missing dates or other anomalies that would call into question the idea that these games constitute a World Series.
4. Confirm that the number of games played at each stadium is sufficient to support a World Series: A seven-game series requires four games at one stadium and three at another. 5. Conclusion: Given the number of games played at each stadium and the absence of any inconsistencies, it is reasonable to conclude that these games constitute a World Series.
